descriptionHtml:
After a request, I removed the cape from the nightingale armor.
[color=#33689e]Now compatible with retexture mods![/color]

[color=#66a1e3][size=\"4\"][u][b]Installation[/b][/u][/size][/color]
Simply extract the Data folder in the Skyrim folder (typically C:/Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim)
[b]This mod is compatible with the [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/content/modmanager]Nexus Mod Manager[/url].[/b] Use it to (un)install and update easily.

[color=#66a1e3][size=\"4\"][u][b]Known issues[/b][/u][/size][/color]
None for now, but keep an eye out for dismemberment, it may be bugged in v2.0, due to a limit with the current tools. Tell me if you find any bug.

[color=#66a1e3][size=\"4\"][u][b]FAQ[/b][/u][/size][/color]
[list]
[*][color=#33689e]Is this compatible with nightingale retexture mods?[/color]
v2.0 is indeed compatible with any retexture mod, v1.0 isn\'t and is obsolete.

[*][color=#33689e]I can see blood spatter in the air behind my character, why is that?[/color]
That\'s because you use v1.0, upgrade.

[*][color=#33689e]I want to see my face, could you remove the mask too?[/color]
I could remove the mask, but there\'s no face behind, I will need the creation kit to make it appear. Once the CK is out, a maskless version will be added.

[*][color=#33689e]I want to see my hair floating in the air, could you do a hoodless version?[/color]
Same problem than previous question, you\'ll have a hoodless version to see your hair when the CK is out. Not sure about the floating though^^

[*][color=#33689e]I didn\'t manage to install this, could you be more precise in your instructions?[/color]
I don\'t see what more to say. If you can\'t install that, I highly recommend you to install the Nexus Mod Manager to have a easy one-click install/uninstall.
[/list]
author: Gilead Maerlyn

files.name: Capeless Nightingale v1-0
files.changelogHtml: Created capeless nightingale by making the cape transparent

files.name: Capeless Nightingale v2
files.changelogHtml: Created capeless nightingale by actually removing the cape
